Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good breakfast, good location, accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: LaCruz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove from our house in Puerto Vallarta to Mexico DF. The hotel let us park our car outside the front door for several days as we toured. They found us a driver to give us a personal tour. Lovely visit in Mexico DF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. I'd you are bored of marriot etc come here...”
Reviews.Author: Andybancroftcooke
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in I loved this hotel. Wonderful rooms with old clocks in the halls. Incredibly comfortable beds, lovely hot shower and wifi all over. Also good food in the restaurant. Super location for the brilliant anthropological museum. Go. It's great.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice...”
Reviews.Author: swedishtravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. The outside of the hotel does not look like a hotel. The reception and its staff is not nice. We always treat people in a nice way, smiling but the people working there did not respond to our kind attitude. They did not make us feel welcome at all. The breakfast and the staff there is also very bad. Small breakfast and the people working there are not nice at all. They should not be working at a hotel. The rooms are clean and roomy but of very old standard. Also the hotel is very badly sound proofed. You can hear everything going on in the rooms on the sides.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here”
Reviews.Author: visitingnow
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I have been looking at many hotels across Zona Rosa/Condesa/Roma to find a place to host my family when they arrive for our wedding. At La Casona, we had a much more unpleasant experience than anywhere else. I don't if it was the way we looked or something but the man at the desk didn't seem too interested in talking to us and giving us information. When we asked about room prices, he said that it would be "maybe 3000, maybe 4000." When we asked if there were rooms with two beds, he never really said yes or no. When we asked to see a room, he just kind of shrugged his shoulders and said that none were available. Certainly we understand if he can't show us anything because they're all occupied but elsewhere the staff would apologize, describe the rooms to us, show us brochures. Here, they just really didn't seem interested in having our business. BTW, my fiancée is Mexican and all the interaction was done in Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, and value...”
Reviews.Author: jhurbina
Reviews.Content: I challenge you to look at the other "boutique" hotels in the area and see their reviews in comparison. If you plan to take the Metro at all and value service and safety, then I believe you can do little better than this hotel at this price point. Love the proximity to restaurants in the Condesa-Roma area, love the proximity to the Sevilla stop on the Linea 1 of the Metro, love having a doorman, love the friendly service. True, dated rooms compared to the US and other competing hotels in the area, true the noise is more than I would prefer, but really if the three items in my title are your priority, then you will be happy with your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: garmic57
Reviews.Content: I paid 125 $ plus taxes a night. I was disappointed by this place and left after 2 nights. Here is why. The location: The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood. There are some restaurants or shops here and there, but â€“ this is of course a matter of taste â€“ I prefer a more animated environment, like the Zona Rosa where I moved later. At least, in a residential neighborhood, I would expect complete calm and quietness, which is not the case here â€“ read below. The staff: Businesslike, frosty, and merely polite. Do they think they have to give themselves an attitude because they work in a posh boutique hotel? Arriving at 9 p.m., after a 18 hour trip, a smile and a warm welcome would have been most appreciated. Nothing of the kind happened. Nor was the TV set mended the following day despite my request. Breakfast was included, but they presented me with a paper to sign and expected a tip. By the way, the breakfast buffet is rather on the small side. The noise: In my reservation e-mail I insisted on a quiet room. They gave me a street room (Durango). Not that much traffic, but enough to bother me. At 4.30 a.m. you will have the garbage collectors, and they do make noise. Furthermore, the first morning at 7 a.m. when I was trying to sleep out my jet lag, the bell boy called me by mistake. Not my idea of a peaceful night. It is true that the place is charming and tastefully decorated, although I didnâ€™t find a spot in my room where to put my laptop computer because the furniture, charming but antique, isnâ€™t adapted. (There was no secure WLAN connection either.) So the place isnâ€™t entirely bad, but it really didnâ€™t fit my needs, and several things need to be seriously improved.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: vibiaron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family reunion, so we had about 10 rooms. Everyone seemed very satisfied. The service, from check-in to check-out, was really friendly and efficient. The hotel rooms, both private and public, are just charming, part of what was once a private mansion. Each room is slightly different. Mine had a huge bathroom, beautifully tiled with colorful Mexican tiles. The air conditioning worked, although if you need the room to be below 75, you might be uncomfortable. Most important - free wifi worked ALL the time! Flat screen TV (cable service was spotty) and nice amenities, including robe and slippers. Comfortable bed. Ask for a room in the back, as mine was facing the street and the noise was disturbing at times, despite the original wooden floor-to-ceiling shutters - another charming element. Pharmacy, convenience store and restaurants are all within walking distance. We ate at an Argentine restaurant directly across the street, which we all really enjoyed. El Palacio de Hierro, an upscale department store with a gourmet food department (we bought Mexican chocolates and 2 cakes to bring to someone's home), is a block away. Neighborhood is Condesa, which is one of the better areas of the city. I never felt unsafe, by the way, although I only walked across the street on my own since I was with a group. At the recommendation of our cousin in DF, we booked our taxi at the airport through Taxi 360 (booth at the end of the airport). You pay at the booth. The hotel called a private car service to return to the airport. Definitely ask your hotel to call a taxi for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just incredible”
Reviews.Author: Ambuyi
Reviews.Content: The moment I got there, someone smiled straight away and started talking to me, the reservation was found quickly and they took me to my room which was a gorgeous old school unique room, i had never seen a room like that. I went to the bar for a drink had an amazing scotch and then i decided why not to go out and walk around. The guy behind the reception saw me going out and decided to give me a map show me the interesting spots of where to go to and told me where not to. I had an amazing time and will definitely come back to this little charming mexican hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: rgomez13
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel with great rooms and an extremely friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a great location”
Reviews.Author: genovevaK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we loved it. The building is beautiful and has lots of character; We loved the decor in our bedroom, it is a very special Mexican style, very colorful and the furniture were very nice also. The location was excellent, we could go walking around to nearby shopping and restaurants. Since we were busy attending a wedding in Mexico City we just had dinner at their restaurant one time. We really like the food and the service, It was a little pricy compared with the prices in Mexico City but we did enjoy it. We canÂ´t wait to go back. Thanks La Casona and staff for making our stay so memorable

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Aconitina
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and I wanted to experience this hotel after I saw it going around the city. The staff is really kind and helpful, the decoration is excellent, rooms are comfortable and quiet, the wireless internet worked fine and the metro station is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Wadders1972
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at La Casona for 4 nights. The hotel staff were helpful with our numerous requests and the rooms were wonderful, clean and quiet. There are two handy computers upstairs with free internet. The concierge also organised a driver, Julio, for our trip to the pyramid site 50 kms from the centre who was extremely knowledgeable and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Work in Progress”
Reviews.Author: bdm123
Reviews.Content: La Casona is a self-described "boutique hotel" in a beutifully restored old mansion, conveniently located in Colonia Roma but a short walk to all the restaurants and nightlife of Condesa. We stayed two nights using a weekend special. It was $279 which included taxes, a ride to the airport, and a few other goodies. There is a metro station a few blocks away. The public areas of the hotel are attractive, with polished dark wood floors and railings, some music-related decor, and cozy dining and sitting areas. Our room was large, with balcony windows that opened to a quiet side street. The bathroom was equally large, and everything worked. well. Our room had a strong shower -- important for blasting off the smell and grime after a long day of exploring D.F. There were a couple of things that we felt could have been improved: The front desk service was inconsistent. The first day, the person seemed almost bothered when we had questions about the hotel or advice on getting around. The next two days, though, the service improved. The bedding was acceptable, but was not of the quality I would expect if paying the full rate of about $180 per night. This applies to both the mattress and the covers. Overall, I'd give it high marks for convenience and attractiveness, but take off a few points for service and comfort, not because they were terrible, but because they made the hotel feel like it was still a work in progress that hasn't quite reached the level of luxury and sophistication it is aiming for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, charming”
Reviews.Author: Robynrobyn
Reviews.Content: La Casona is located in the northwestern edge of the Colonia Roma, very close to the Colonia Condesa. Nearby there are no other hotels and therefore no tourists, just middle class Mexicans. The area is lively during the day and very quite at night. The building is from the early 1900s, obviously renovated and full of character. We had an exterior room, which was spacious and interesting. It faced a side street, so there was no traffic noise. However, early in the morning I could hear a few hundred birds singing from the leafy main street where the hotel is located (not a bad way to wake up). The staff was very friendly and efficient: Our luggage didn't arrive in our flight, and the staff took care of following up with the airline and arranging for delivery to our rooms the following day. Also, we told them that we wanted to visit the house of famous Mexican architect Luis Barragan (not a common tourist spot) and they took care of arranging the visit while we went for lunch to Contramar. This is one of the best seafood restaurants in the city, and it is a couple of blocks from the hotel (unfortunately it is not open for dinner). The coffee shop next door is very convenient (try the cafe cortado). There are several art galleries nearby (Casa Lamm is walking distance from the hotel) and the lovely Parque Mexico and Calle Amsterdam are also within 15min walking distance (try Bistro Mosaico and the fresh fruit juices on the opposite corner).

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: tripellen
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with this hotel. Whilst it is pricey it had a lovely feel, great restaurant and really spacious, tasteful rooms (3rd floor). Additionally, high speed internet was available for no charge. The staff were helpful and professional. The location is good with cafes and a shopping centre nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff rips visitor on car with driver rentals”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff, after negotiation, will quote $150 a day for a car and driver. Driver will be paid $75, an excessive recommendation fee, don't you think? The hotel is in a pleasant, safe, quiet location, buffet breakfast is nice, beds are boards, a tad musty, stairs, inadequate bed reading lights. Mostly older European guests.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: publicpeter
Reviews.Content: Attractive, very comfortable hotel with charm. Spotless. Very friendly service, though not all the front desk people are equally comfortable in English. Conveniently located on nice street near hot dining areas and subways. Restaurant in hotel is quite good. It was fun wathching some of the local power elite at their breakfast meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with character in good area of Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Martin023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Casona for five nights. Our bedroom was large and comfortable. Tastefully furnished, with a very comfortable bed and a large bathroom. Very clean. It's a period building with character, not a chain hotel. Staff were friendly and approachable and all spoke good English. The buffet breakfast included in the price of the room was healthy and satisfying. It was served in a nice restaraunt with a lovely, small terrace. We had an evening meal in the restaraunt that was also very good. The hotel is in a central location, on a relatively quiet road in an area that felt safe, with plenty of shops and restaraunts. The hotel also provides a private taxi service that is friendly, reliable, safe and good value. Overall, this is a lovely hotel with lots of character in a good area, providing good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own mattress”
Reviews.Author: DrewV
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at this hotel, having heard all the glowing reviews on this site. And while the hotel certainly had a ton of character, with cute rooms and friendly staff, we ultimately were disappointed. The problem is two-fold: 1) The bed was extraordinarily uncomfortable. It felt as though the mattress hadn't been changed in thirty years so my wife and I could feel each individual spring stabbing us in the back. Pillows offered no support as well. 2) Although the hotel is described as being in Condesa, it's really not. There are very few restaurants in walking distance (although La Tecla is excellent), and the neighborhood has a dodgy feel to it. Yes, it's a nice place, but I'm not sure it's worth the high praise lavished upon it. Maybe with more comfortable beds?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: La Casona is a beautiful hotel with wonderful service. The location is ideal for just wandering around and exploring. We felt perfectly safe even though we barely spoke Spanish. People are very friendly and willing to try to communicate even though most people do not speak English. We thought our room was excellent. It was extremely clean and was furnished well. The hotel also provides a very safe, reliable, and reasonably priced private taxi service for all guests (which is extremely important in Mexico City). We used the taxi service each time we travelled anywhere that we could not walk. And just a FYI: Izote Restaurant in the Polanco District is wonderful for a very exquisite dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, warm, boutique home away from home”
Reviews.Author: beardiegal
Reviews.Content: Amidst the hustle bustle, traffic and smog of Mexico City, a gem of a place is la casona... went new years 2005, bought sight unseen on expedia, and found the loveliest, quaintest, little hotel with personal attention.... taxi driver had to call to locate when we arrived at 10pm, although it is very conveniently located to cultural spots, on a one way street and clearly not catering to the chain hotel crowd... but the hunt was worth it! its like our sf bay hotels, built on a really fine small restaurant, where local elite families congregate for sunday brunch..... the rooms are very idiosyncratic, individual and comfy, slippers and cozy plush robes for your use....hot water, bottled water to drink, plush towels, great toiletries, eally San Francisco like in its qualities....staff spoke english well, handled many reservations, arrangements for us, very attentive.... some rooms are dark, others light, but as we went to mexico city for the cultural stuff, then headed to mountains and sea for the outdoors, worked fine for us... would go back again and again, and know our needs would be catered to....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Mexico City last Easter Week (2005) and we stayed in La Casona Hotel. It is a small and comfortable hotel located in La Roma, an old, colonial and well secure neighborhood. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. The price includes breakfast and it is very delicious. The hotel is close from Chapultepec Park, some museums; Zona Rosa (Pink Zone) and nice neighborhoods (Polanco, La Condesa) were you could find tasty food in cozy restaurants. Unfortunately, my husband got VERY sick, food poisoning by Burger King's salad and burgers (DON'T EAT IN BURGER KING - NEVER!) two nights before we ended our trip. The staff's hotel was very preoccupied and took care of us all the time. They had to bring a doctor, who arrived in 15 minutes, and he found my husband with a third degree of dehydration and a huge gastrointestinal infectious that let my husband weak and under medication for several days. The doctor and nurse were very professionals and friendly. They applied to my husband fluids through an IV to speed up the dehydration process. Nonetheless, and despite the terrible time we had for the bad choice we made to eat in Burger King, we had a very good time in Mexico. We recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: VRL
Reviews.Content: La Casona is wonderful for gracious service, unique charm, an interesting location, and comfortable amenities. The nearby areas of Roma and Condessa are like the Village, with cafes and great dining. It is also easily accessible to Zona Rosa. The service is wonderful and you will always feel well cared for by the friendly doormen, the turn-down chocolates, the cozy bathrobes, etc. The building is very charming and fun to explore. I found a wonderfully affordable rate online for our stay, so I accordingly expected one of the smaller rooms described in the online reviews posted here. While it was somewhat dark in terms of natural light and not enormous and even had the cherub theme one reviewer expressed disgust at, it was actually extremely comfortable with tasteful decor, plenty of lamps, a very large bathroom, a sumptuous bed, nice toiletries, and basically everthing else to make one's stay feel 5-star (even if one is in the budget room!). While the free breakfast buffet was very nice, we loved ordering the inexpensive but wonderful room service huevos rancheros. This is a unique and lovely choice for Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great room!”
Reviews.Author: finneywatt
Reviews.Content: Unlike some of your other reviewers my husband I had a great if too short stay at La Casona last October. We loved our room which looked out onto the street (lively during day, quiet at night with double hung french-type doors), great bathroom and all told just a lovely place. We've told all our friends about it and would definitely go back. The staff was wonderful, especially considering our language skills and helped us make a bus by getting us special taxi service when we were running very late. Wish I were there right now!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value, great room, exceptionally helpful staff and top location”
Reviews.Author: glesgamail
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at La Casona over Christmas and could not have been more satisfied with the place. It is located in an excellent neighbourhood, just a 15minute walk from the Athropology Museum, a few streets away from the trendy cafes of Condesa and there is a subway station just two blocks away. Our room was spacious and was furnished in a perfectly inoffensive antique style. It opened on to a central atrium â€“ which meant the room was dark, but it would also help keep it cool in the summer. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Best of all, the staff were exceptionally helpful, providing information and assistance which made our stay in Mexico City memorable foir all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the service/location, hated the room...”
Reviews.Author: HHPas
Reviews.Content: La Casona is in a great location. The service is good. Unfortunately, the room that I was assigned was the WORST HOTEL ROOM I HAVE EVER STAYED IN. The room was miniscule, and the only window faced a narrow light shaft, rather than outside, making the room feel even more cramped and clausterphobic. The furnishings appeared to be garage sale finds. There was an oppressive cherub design motif. The television had a 12" screen. I felt as if I had stepped into the twilight zone. On the plus side, however, there were extensive cable TV offerings. And as I walked down the hall on my was to check out the next morning, I was able to survey some of the other rooms. All were nicer than mine had been. Most even had windows... Would I stay there again? It's pretty far down on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Wild on La Casona”
Reviews.Author: jayci
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at La Casona in May of 2004, and we could not have had a better experience. The staff is extremely helpful and mostly English speaking, the beds are comfortable and rooms cleverly appointed. It is a little bit more off the beaten path and you will have to walk a little or take cabs if you want to get anywhere, but it is not terribly far from the subway, and that can help hasten the journey. If you want to stay somewhere that isn't a chain, La Casona is the place to stay in Mexico City. Note: my fiancee did get ill eating the cheese on the last day in the breakfast buffet. We don't think it is the kitchen's fault nearly as much as it is the gastrnomic adventure of eating in a country that uses (potentially) unpasturized milk in their food.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nova2010
Reviews.Content: La Casona is a very quiet and charming boutique hotel. Ideally located, it only took us 20 minutes to reach the nearby exciting 'Zona Rosa'. Our room was very clean and well furnished with 2 large wardrobes and a huge tub. Breakfasts are gorgeous with fruits, cereals, breads & buns and nature fruit juice. The staff is very friendly and helpful, we really enjoyed this great place!

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La Casona!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: La Casona was everything we expected from a mid-sized boutique hotel, and was worth every penny. Friendly staff, beautiful, immaculate rooms with huge bath tubs (lots of hot water pressure!), a fresh fruit basket, huge, comfortable bed and air conditioning - all in this gorgeous, character building. Our room overlooked the small central courtyard/dining area, and peaceful water fountain. The breakfast part of the B&B was more than adequate - cereals, breads, fresh fruit and juices, eggs to order, and the evening meals were fine. If we ever visit the cacophony that is Mexico City again, we will definately reside in the lovely respite of La Casona!

HotelInfo.Name: La Casona
HotelInfo.Address: Durango 280, Mexico City 06700, Mexico
